statements.name: PROC IMPORT
statements.description: The IMPORT procedure reads external data and writes the data to a SAS data set or CAS table if the CAS LIBNAME engine is used. You must have a connection to the CAS server.

arguments.name: DATAFILE=
arguments.description: specifies the complete path and file name or fileref for the input file. A fileref is a SAS name that is associated with the physical location of the output file. To assign a fileref, use the FILENAME= statement.

arguments.name: DATATABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the table name of the input DBMS table. If the name does not include special characters, such as question marks, lowercase characters, or spaces, you can omit the quotation marks. The DBMS table name might be case sensitive. DATATABLE= is generally used for Microsoft Access database tables, but it is not used for Microsoft Excel files.

arguments.name: SAS-data-set-options
arguments.description: specify SAS data set options. For example, to assign a password to the resulting SAS data set, you can use these options: ALTER=, PW=, READ=, or WRITE=. To import only data that meets a specified condition, you can use the WHERE= data set option.

arguments.name: DBMS=
arguments.description: specifies the type of data to import. To import a DBMS table, specify DBMS= using a supported database identifier listed in . For example, DBMS=CSV specifies to import a delimited file with comma-separated values. This table shows the available DBMS= identifiers. Except as noted in the table, all DBMS= specifications refer to local access.

arguments.name: ACCESS
arguments.description: DBMS=ACCESSCS uses the PC Files LIBNAME engine connecting through the PC Files Server.

arguments.name: CSV
arguments.description: Specifies a delimited file (comma-separated values).

arguments.name: DLM
arguments.description: Specifies a delimited file (The default delimiter is a blank. You must specify the delimiter using the DELIMITER= statement.)

arguments.name: DTA
arguments.description: Specifies a Stata file.

arguments.name: EXCELCS
arguments.description: Specifies that the IMPORT procedure uses the PC Files LIBNAME engine transparently to import Excel files. The PC must be running the SAS PC Files Server.

arguments.name: JMP
arguments.description: Specifies JMP files in Version 7 and later format.

arguments.name: PARADOX
arguments.description: Specifies Paradox DB files.

arguments.name: PCFS
arguments.description: Specify DBMS=PCFS to connect to the SAS PC Files Server to import JMP, SPSS, and Stata files. DBMS=PCFS enables you to access data from Linux. You can connect to the server through the Compute Server.

arguments.name: SAV
arguments.description: Specifies SPSS files.

arguments.name: TAB
arguments.description: Specifies a delimited file (tab-delimited values).

arguments.name: XLS
arguments.description: Specifies that you can read and write to an Excel workbook under Linux directly without having to access the SAS PC Files Server.

arguments.name: XLSX
arguments.description: Specifies that you can read and write to an Excel workbook under Linux directly without having to access the SAS PC Files Server.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: identifies the output SAS data set with either a one- or two-level SAS name (library and data set names). If the specified SAS data set does not exist, the IMPORT procedure creates it. If you specify a one-level name, by default the IMPORT procedure uses either the SASUSER library if assigned or it uses the WORK library if SASUSER not assigned.

arguments.name: REPLACE
arguments.description: overwrites an existing SAS data set. If you omit REPLACE, the IMPORT procedure does not overwrite an existing file.

arguments.name: file-format-specific-statements
arguments.description: See for the supported syntax for your data source.

arguments.name: SERVERAUTHDOMAIN=
arguments.description: Allows connection to a server by specifying the name of an authentication domain metadata object.
